javax.constraints

Interface Var

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConstrainedVariable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    VarBool

    public interface Var
extends ConstrainedVariable
    This interface represents constrained integer variables, the most frequently used type of constrained objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Var abs()
      Returns a new Var that is constrained to be the absolute value of this variable.
      VarReal asReal() 
      boolean contains(int value)
      Returns true if the domain of this variable contains the value.

      Returns a new Var that is constrained to be the division of this variable by the given variable, i.e.

      Returns the current number of values inside the domain of this variable.
      DomainType getDomainType()
      Returns the type of this variable's domain.
      java.lang.String getInitialDomain()
      Returns a string representation of the initial domain of this variable.
      int getMax()
      Returns the current maximum value in the domain of this variable.

      Returns the current minimum value in the domain of this variable.

      Returns the value to which this variable has been instantiated, throws a RuntimeException if the variable is not instantiated.

      • divide

        Var divide(int value)
        Returns a new Var that is constrained to be the division of this variable by the given value, i.e. this / value.
        Parameters:
        value - the given value.
        Returns:
        a Var that represents: this / value.

      • divide

        Var divide(Var var)
    throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a new Var that is constrained to be the division of this variable by the given variable, i.e. this / var.
        Parameters:
        var - the given variable.
        Returns:
        a Var that represents: this / var.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if dividing by zero.

        Var power(int value)

        Returns:
        a Var that represents: this**value.

      • setDomainType

        void setDomainType(DomainType type)
        Changes the domain type of this variable. Setting domain type AFTER a variable was created allows to take into consideration posted constraints and other problem state specific information.
        Parameters:
        type -

      • sqr

        Var sqr()
        Returns a new Var that is constrained to be the product of this variable and itself, i.e. this * this.
        Returns:
        a Var that represents: this * this.
